text: Dina (, ,also spelled Dinah, Dena, Deena) [ dahy-nuh ] is a female given name. Dina is a Muslim or Hebrew name that carries the meaning of "judgment" or "vindication". ==Origin== The name comes from the Hebrew word din, which means "judge". This name is frequently linked to Dinah, a character from the Bible who was the daughter of Jacob and Leah. This is a unique name – not in the top 1000 newborn names in the US in 2021. == People == * Dina bint Abdul-Hamid (1929–2019), Queen consort of Jordan, first wife of King Hussein * Dina Carroll (born 1968), English singer * Dina Ali Lasloom * Dina Merrill, stage name of Nedenia Marjorie Hutton (1923–2017), American actress, socialite and philanthropist * Dina Powell (born 1973), American businesspeople and former government officeholder * Dina Titus (born 1950), Nevada politician * Dina Wadia (1919–2017), daughter of Mohammad Ali Jinnah, the founder of Pakistan ==References==
title: Dina (name)
